cyclone.name: ZETA
cyclone.current_location: about 450 mi south of the mouth of the Mississippi River
cyclone.trajectory: accelerating north-to-north-northeast across the central Gulf toward southeastern Louisiana and then inland across the southeast United States
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: southeastern Louisiana coastline (near Port Fourchon–Grand Isle area)

port.name: Port of Greater Baton Rouge, LA

weather_observation.under_warning: Hurricane Warning (coastal zone) / Inland Tropical Storm Warning likely
weather_observation.watch_coast: West of Morgan City to Intracoastal City, Louisiana (Tropical Storm Watch)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Morgan City, LA to the Mississippi/Alabama border including Lake Pontchartrain, Lake Maurepas, and Metropolitan New Orleans (Hurricane Warning)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire northern Gulf Coast from the Mouth of the Atchafalaya River eastward to the western Florida Panhandle
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (sustained 35-45 mph, gusts 50-60 mph) possible Wednesday evening through early Thursday; brief stronger gusts if the center passes just west of the port.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor riverine surge/rise possible up the Lower Mississippi, but significant coastal surge is expected south of the port rather than at the port itself.
weather_observation.rainfall: 2–4 inches with isolated 6 inch pockets; potential for local flash flooding in low-lying terminal areas.
weather_observation.other_hazards: A few brief tornadoes possible in surrounding parishes Wednesday evening as outer rain bands move inland.
